name: Ponce De Leon Hotel

reviews.text: I unpacked and took a shower where I noticed the plastic shower curtain had holes in it- it looked like someone chewed on it. The walls looked like something had also been chewing on them and the curtains had a large burned section at the bottom. I left for the evening and I got back to my room late that night.
reviews.title: don't stay here
Nice Place
reviews.text: When I pulled back the comforter, I noticed that the sheets on the bed had what appeared to be two small circular brownish red stains on them, the bed skirt was burned, and the comforter had a large stain and two cigarette burns on it. I took the sheets off of my bed and slept on the hotel towels in my clothes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay at the Ponce de Leon Hotel was very nice. Cute boutique hotel. The rooms are adorable. Nice staff. GREAT LOCATION. One street over from the water, walking distance to a lot of shops, restraurants/bars. There was a craft show/festival right next to the hotel held on Saturdays. We went to see the Red Sox play. We were able to walk to and from the stadium to avoid TRYING to get a cab afterwards. Not a hop, skip and jump distance wise but manageable, and we also were able to see what else was around the area blocks over. Will definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Cute hotel, GREAT location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is very old, but very quaint. With a super delicious Tapas Bar/Restaurant on the first floor and a newly remodeled lobby - this hotel is great for a weekend trip. The rooms are small and furnished with old style furnishings - the bed was small, but clean! Super small bathrooms but also very clean. Small Staff was great and they took care of all our problems. I would recommend to anyone looking to stay downtown for a few nights and not wanting to spend a fortune. You get what you pay for!! If you are looking for large, newly furnished rooms and tons of staff, room service or newer accomdations the Ponce is not for you. But small and sweet it is for sure.
reviews.title: Small but Cute and Clean

likes.liked: — Location to all the complexes downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only complaints: Small beds and the parking - there is no on site parking, you have to park across the street and it's 5 dollars per visit (must have exact change). But the hotel is located close to BayWalk and other dining and covenience stores, so you can walk with no problems.
reviews.title: A Quirky Place That Was OK

reviews.text: As my room partner commented, you get what you pay for. I was looking for a bargain place to stay close to the St. Pete Crawfish Festival. The Ponce offered reasonable rates for "the season" and wasn't far from the festival venue. It was described to me as remodeled and clean, but older. I paid a bit more for a waterview room.
reviews.title: Upscale at a fantastic price!!

likes.liked: — Front desk staff VERY polite and helpful

reviews.title: the hotel with alot of history
reviews.text: First, parking--there isn't any. In fact, we circled the block several times trying to figure out where to unload our luggage. We finally parked illegally on the corner and used the hotel's only luggage rack to get our things inside. Thankfully, the rain hadn't started yet. We were directed to park in a lot on the next block kitty corner to the hotel that is $5.00 a day with no in and out priviledges. The elevators of the parking garage are on the far side of the next block. We took a cab out that evening rather than jump over puddles and get wet trying to get to the lot. The next day, I parked on the street after being advised the city doesn't enforce the parking restrictions on the weekends. I got a $17.50 ticket.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I always stay at what we call "The Ponce" when staying in downtown St Pete. We LOVE it! Quaint, charming, unique hotel that has been fastastically redone - the rooms are modern contemporary and we especially love the hard wood floors and comfy beds with down comforters. We have been lucky to get corner rooms twice now - and they are the best! The room by the elevator was our least favorite - much smaller than the rest. The location is awesome (within walking distance to everything downtown) and the staff are always great. Make sure and try the sangria next door at Ceviche - yum!
reviews.title: We LOVE the PONCE - our favorite St Pete hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location 4 sure, rooms nice, toilets too small and too old, bed sheets with big holes. Wi fi in the rooms not available (even if concierge says the opposite). About the rate, it was average
reviews.title: so and so

reviews.text: I wouldn't stay on the 2nd or 3rd floors. The hotel is built on top of a restaurant, which is on top of a bar. Its probably OK on a weeknight, but on the weekends, the loud bass thumping won't stop until 2am. I felt like I was back at college with my annoying neighbor jamming out to all hours of the night.
reviews.title: Noisiest place in St. Pete

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did get them to move us to the 6th floor for the last 2 nights of the stay, but only after arguing with the staff and threatening to check out early. 6th floor is great for the view, but it reeked of the oil used to cook the apparently tasty tapas at the aforementioned restaurant.
reviews.title: Adorable little hotel, great location!

reviews.text: I definietly agree. You get what you pay for, so beware.
reviews.title: Miserable.

likes.liked: — nothing, couldn't wait to ck out..
likes.disliked: — where's the bathroom in this toilet.

description: Often called a “downtown gem,” the Ponce de Leon Hotel is centrally located in the heart of downtown Saint Petersburg. Whether you’re after the nightlife or the art galleries, you can find it all within a short walk from this full-service hotel. Nearby attractions include the Salvador Dali Museum, the Dale Chihuly Exhibition, and Jannus Live, as well as countless restaurants, bars, and theaters.Tropicana Field is just a short walk or shuttle ride away if you’re in town for a Rays’ game or visiting the area to watch a concert at Jannus Live. Constructed in 1922, recent renovations bring new life to this landmark hotel while maintaining the excitement of the roaring twenties. The building’s Spanish Mission Revival style, blends well with the modern skyline of the city’s scenic downtown waterfront. Offering rooms with breath-taking views of the bay and of the city, you could not ask for a better location to soak up Florida's warm sun or enjoy all that the city has to offer. The Ponce de Leon welcomes you with old world charm as well as modern conveniences such as air-conditioned rooms featuring flat screen cable TVs, free wireless internet, mini-bars, in-room coffee and on-premise laundry facilities.
